Most movies are in 2.35:1 because that is how they are filmed and presented in most cinemas. They could theoretically, most of the time, change aspect ratio, but that would mean eitheradding space to the top or bottom of the frame, or cutting out information left/right. And when the framing of a shot is dependant of 2.35:1 aspect ratio, changing it will compromise the intention of the director/DP etc.

Though I just have to ask, if you are worried by the resolution, why are you commenting on a 720p rip? Surely the 1080p versions will satisfy you more. Also most video players will allow you to define the aspect ratio to for example 16:9, if you want to cut off the sides in order to fill the entire TV/screen you are displaying on.
